-doesn't include free appetizers
-CHARGES FOR TEA...
-you'll hate this restaurant someday/any time of your life (not just this restaurant... all their locations suck).
-DON'T GO THERE? PICK SOMEWHERE ELSE! LOL

Regret:
Giving her a $5 tip
author: ABC Z.

description:
For the amount of money I spent here, I could have gone to a  real Korean restaurant and ordered a bbq dish or tofu stew with a lot of typical Korean side dishes.

I think the entire Hahn's Hibachi chain changed owners or something.  The menu changed, the food doesn't taste quite the same.  Very disappointing.  

Right when you walk in, there's a certain kind of funk and then it goes downhill from there.
author: Ernest Y.

description: wow. what is this?? how could you possibly eat korean food with authentic korean flavors exempt? Very nice owner that I feel bad writing this review - OK, the food was edible (had the lunch special), but If you're one who loves Korean food, you'd be insulted with their BBQ beef. Basically, it's American-style Korean food, accommodating weak, unimaginative palates. (And if you want exemplary Korean food, go to LA, Koreatown).
author: Audrey L.

description: I would not call this place authentic Korean as it is more of a fusion style of food.  Like people have said, the portions are good for the price which is the major plus I think.  Being automobileless I take the Judah N Line that passes by this particular location and drop by once in a while.  Not the best "Korean" food in town, but an easy quick fix that will fill you up right.  It's awesome that the waitress (who always seems to be the same girl all the time with a crazy manicure) actually speaks Korean - that's bonus points for me.  As far the menu items, I've only tried their bi-bim-bap both in the stone bowl and without and both were a pleasant surprise considering there aren't many Koreans in this area of town to my knowledge.  Probably should only give this place 3 stars, but because of my sometimes desperate cravings for close Korean food, I'll barely give this a 4.
author: Sokokyu K.

description: Small location and clean bathroom. Tried the afternoon special.  Everything was fine, but to make this place a 4 star or higher, need a different sauce for the meat.  I liked salad and tempura appetizer, but when it came time for the main meal, the sauce was weak in taste and flavor.  Service was fine and attentive, but missing 1 detail in flavor made the meal average as well as the rating.
author: Jesse M.

description: I wasn't a fan of their food. I didn't like the little octopus in the salad. Also when I went here, my dad and I realized we had left the oven on while baking an apple pie, so he had to go home and turn off the oven, and then come back. That might have ruined the dinner, but all in all, the food wasn't so great.
author: O K.

description: I eat dinner here somewhat frequently. The tempura was really good, but I usually just order the Bi Bim Bop, which is pretty good. This place wins because it is nearby my house. I would never come to the Inner Sunset with the intention of just coming here. To be honest, though, I haven't been blown away by any Korean food I've had recently.
author: Jessica W.

description: my favorite local spot!  i only order the sizzling bee bim bop and the spicy bbq beef but theyre both so good theres no need to expand my horizons..
author: Alison T.

description: We've been there a few times and always order the chicken sandwich.  We call it in and get it to go.  It comes in a neatly wrapped package, no leakage.  It's a perfect size to sneak it into the movies.  ;)
author: Delilah B.

description: Chocolate slut thinks the Hahn's on Polk is better....I say, I can't tell a damn difference.  I love the spicy pork with a fried egg on top and the tasty fruity gum I get with my check.  Now, Hahn's is no Brothers (more authentic Korean), and I don't care, because Hahn's is good!!!
author: Christina S.

description: I ate here a long time ago and had the famous korean bbq chicken. I think it was hyped up too much by my friends because it was super good like it had sounded! The chicken comes with a scoop of rice and also a salad. The portions were also not that big considering the price. I would eat here again but try something different. I havent seen many Korean bbq places in my area so Hahns is an ideal place for me to go.
author: Miss H K.

description: Keeping up with the American tradition, bigger is better.  Feel like you could eat a mountain of meat?  Well they have a "Mountain of Meat" on the menu.  This was the first one of the 5 Hahn's I've been too and always hold that special place in my stomach.  Great bbq and a decent price for an entire mountain of meat.
author: patrick o.

description: Took my roommate here before she knew of Han's and I couldn't wait to share my love of their bbq chicken. They have decent prices for a straight-forward meal. She liked it. I was happy she liked it. And we kept going back at least once a week for... forever!
author: Michael R.

description: This place is close to my work, so I end up going for luch quite a lot. I love their lunch menu. Their BBQ meat is really good. Go and try it.............
author: Ghiz S.

description: I've been going to Hahn's Hibachi on Irving for a few years now and I usually order the spicy BBQ beef, but the other things on the menu are pretty good, too, such as the noodles. Hahn's Hibachi has a lunch special which is about $6-7 and it comes with BBQ pork/chicken/beef (your choice), salad, pot stickers, and shrimp tempura. I highly recommend going in for lunch, it's worth it.
author: Edgar G.

description: reasonable prices, fast and polite service, and  hits the spot when you're craving some korean food. i got take out bbef bi bim bap from here on my way to the 44 bus stop, and i couldnt wait to get home so i could eat it! they give you a pretty big serving, although they were kind of stingy with the meat, which is where the bulk of the price goes. regardless, the food was good. nothing spectacular and ive had better, but still good enough that im thinking about going back again later this week.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Tasty, really good food, not greasy. And I love to say "bi bim bop, please!"
author: Nicole S.

description: Small sized place but the portions, prices, and food were really good!  I had the short ribs and they gave 3 large pieces, 2 mounds of rice, and salad!  So filling!
author: Carmen M.

description: Great place for my lunch when escaping from the drone of the UCSF campus food.  Cheap and satisfying combo plates.
author: Amy H.

description:
I love eating at this place. The food is good, atmosphere cozy and the service friendly. I don't mind eating here. I get good service and good quality food. Nothing more I could want.

However, they could servre more condiments than just plain Kim Chi. Then again this place is not a true Korean resturaunt..... But great anyway.
author: Big C.

description: Highly recommend the "Sizzling Pot - Bi Bim Bop with Spicy Pork".  It's my favorite on a cold day and ultimate comfort food.  Service is not great and it's tiny, but the food is well worth getting.
author: Jaemi S.

description: I've gone here twice and I have to say that both times the food was great!  Spicy pork is a must order as well as the Stuffed mushroom Tempura.  If you get the Combonation platter of Tempura it has stuffed jalapeno tempura too which is amazing!  I have to say that this location is a very small place and you shouldn't bring a large group unless its slow.  The first time I went to Hahn's I went with three four other people and the place was packed, I had to sit on the window sill until a chair was available, but the server found me one after a few minutes.  And if you've never had Korean beer order a "Hite."  All in all its a great cheap place to go with a friend or two, but not for a large group.
author: Dave M.

description: I love this place. Good neighborhood food. You can bring a book because it is pretty bright (for my aging eyes). I love how their medium spicy is just right for me!
author: Avril S.

description: Thumbs down for this place!  I went here with a friend of mine two nights ago and what a waste of money this turned out to be.  My friend and I were talking and catching up when the old hag of a waitress comes over and asks if we were ready to order.  We hadn't had a chance to look at the menu yet (we'd been there about 5 mins) and she basically ordered us to order before we talked.  WTF???  You're gonna tell your customers to order before they talk?  Ok hag!  So we ordered the seafood tofu soup (medium spicy) and the BBQ rib combo.  Let me just say that if you want a good bowl of tofu soup take your ass over to Tofu House on Geary because the soup at Hahn's was bland and tasteless.  Not only that but they don't give you the raw egg to crack open and drop into the soup.  The bbq rib combo was pretty much one short rib, one pork spare rib, and one beef spare rib that was each basically covered in the same sauce.  Not too creative there.  Overall the service was terrible at this place, and the food wasn't worth the money.   Needless to say, I will not make a return trip to this joint.  I'll stick to the Korean restaurants on Geary, or in the Fillmore.
author: D L.

description: I used to live right near this place. Their menu is funny - they definitely over-dramatize the food, but in a good way. The Korean BBQ dishes are yummy, and you get a lot of food for your money. Some things just didn't turn out quite right, like the udon and some seafood offerings, but stick with the standards and you'll be fine. I took a group of friends from Pennsylvania here and they were impressed. I like the $1.50 Coronas. Overall, not five star food, but a good place to get a good and reasonably priced meal (and their take-out is fast, too!).
author: Tess K.

description: yummy meats and other eats but much better to take out than eat in. unless you like being ignored for 20 minutes ? I was kind of weirded out by the faded soda cans and beer labels. but ! I really loved the cashier's manicure; you see, these things matter to me
author: Prima D.

description:
i originally thought this place was a super expensive korean bbq place but its not. came here for lunch though and it was a cheap $8ish for a rather large plate. ordered the bbq beef+gyoza+tempura special. beef was too salty and strong. they also put sauce over the rice. this wouldnt be so bad if the sauce wasnt salty enough. with the salty sauce over rice i didnt have anything to eat the salty beef with so it was straight up salt if you know what i mean.

even so id still come back if i want a cheap filling meal. ill just tell them to lay off on the salt and the sauce on rice.
author: Kyle Z.

description: Weird coming to yelp and finding all the slag reviews of this place. Maybe I was there on an off day but this has been the best beef bi bim bop I've had in SF so far. I know! Weird! I went to Tofu House on Geary the other night for the first time because of all the love that place gets here and man...I spent nearly double on the same dish ($14 I think for bi bim bop) and there was truly little flavor at all! Seriously disappointing. Even after I put the hot sauce all over their bi bim bop, fail. BUT, a couple days later I end up trying Hahn's on a whim and the beef bi bim bop was excellent and only like $8! The beef was very well marinated, the veggies were fresh and plentiful, and the server was actually nice. No, really! She even let us in before they officially opened for lunch because we were just checking out the menu outside. Maybe they are trying to "beef" up business but they served a nice lunch. My wife liked the tofu stew as well. Not the best she's had but very good. I'd come back here for bi bim bop anytime if it is like this first visit. Jus' sayin' :-) Get the bi bim bop and you should be happy.  I'm only giving 5 stars cuz they need some love here. Okay, go.
author: McKay G.

description: LOVE the bi bim bop. It is amazing a must have. The BBQ chicken and pork sandwich are also amazing but there is nothing like sizzling bi bim bop to satisfy an appetite.
author: Katharine M.

description: i gave this place 4 stars. off the bat we were greeted with a warm hello. with the help of the waitress we ordered the spicy pork & chicken, the mountain meat combo, and the spicy tofu soup. just enough for 3 i would say. the spicy pork was probably the best item we ordered. tender and tasty. yuuuum! probably should have just ordered the pork alone for more because the other two guys ate it all and i only had like 3 pieces! the mountain meat combo consisted of pork ribs, beef ribs, and chicken i believe. all was good except our chicken was hard and dry. if it wasn't for the great service and the fact that we got an extra plate of rice and salad probably would have got a 3 star. i really appreciated the extra effort from our server. for some reason we couldnt decide and she saved us some time. i brought my appetite and they brought the meat, that's all that matters!
author: mike c.

description: I climbed meat mountain and I have been reborn.  No longer shall I scoff at other cultures supposed meager attempts at bbq.  And holy cow was it cheap.  I feel like I could become the antithesis of Tantalus were I allowed to take squatting rights over their refuse bin.
author: Jay G.

description: not the best place to go for dinner in the inner sunset.   wish i would have tried something else.  ended up eating here solo and the waitress was slow and unfriendly.  it seemed like it would have been easier to order at the counter.  not really a place one wants to get waited on.  it's also pricey.  i ate the bbq chicken and pork ribs combo along with just a glass of water - $14 (with tip).  loved the bbq chicken not crazy about the pork ribs (they were hard on the bone and the bone looked liked a pigs actual leg).  i liked the dressing on the tiny side salad.
author: Keri K.

description: there's something on the menu aboout a sauce that's so delicious it would make even shredded newspaper taste good.  well, the sauce was just so-so.  the do have some decent spicey chicken dishes though.
author: vlad k.

description:
the food was great! but im not a fan of the interior. it wasnt dazzling. 
we had the appetizer combo (fried shrimp, mushroom, jalapeno that was SPICYYY)... and i ordered the bbq chicken bi bim bop, which was really good! i guess people usually do take-out.
author: Judy L.

description: I always enjoy Hahn's Hibachi.  We went there last night and I was reminded what a nice, cheap and delicious place it is.  It's nice to have a neighborhood joint where you can expect really good food at reasonable prices.  As some of the reviews suggest, the service isn't always the greatest and the atmosphere is certainly low key.  But, hey, just set your expectations before you go and enjoy some tasty affordable Korean food.
author: Dave B.
